description: Primes of the form n^3 + n^2 + 17, for non-negative values of n.
comments: n=-2 produces the prime 13. - _Robert Price_, Apr 25 2016
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Prime-Generating Polynomial.
mathematica: lst={};Do[p=n^3+n^2+17;If[PrimeQ[p],AppendTo[lst,p]],{n,0,3*5!}];lst (* _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Jan 28 2009 *)Select[Table[n^3+n^2+17,{n,0,51800}],PrimeQ] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Dec 08 2011 *)
prog: (MAGMA) [a: n in [0..100] | IsPrime(a) where a is  n^3+n^2+17]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Dec 08 2011
author: _Eric W. Weisstein_
extensions: Altered definition to require that n be non-negative. - _Robert Price_, Apr 25 2016
